lines.text:
[to Ernie]
The safest place in the world is a crowd.
All women are bullies, Revel. Daughters are the worst.
I will bet you a dozen roses if you show this note to your father, he'll give it his deepest consideration.
I'm not a gambler, Mr. Revel.
I think you are, Miss Frensham... or you wouldn't be here.

[to Jane]
I think if a jewel thief ever looked at you, he'd never know what jewelry you were wearing.

[to the cabbie]
Scotland Yard please, cabbie.
You know, the way you say that, Mr. Connor, it could almost be the Ritz.
Well now, all we have to do is find a man who is vain, egotistical, and charming. How many men are there in London?
And how many of those men are vain, egotistical, and charming?
Woof, that should make it simple. You take a million and a half, and I'll take a million and a half.
